pullrequest.title: expose ros topic to change MultiSense SL camera udpate rates and image resolution (per issue #76).

content.raw:
copying my commit comment over here (hadn't noticed it was a commit :) ):

Hmm, I don't know how the real MultiSense SL handles this but different camera modes would seem to expose an easier to use and more consistent solution. Or, given that there's also a difference between RGB and grayscale mode which would result in 6 or 8 different modes when included, adjust framerate as a parameter of resolution and color mode whenever the user changes resolution or color mode. Unless MultiSense allows users to change the update rate independent of resolution.

The resolution settings should also stick to the MultiSense specifications - i.e. have discrete modes, or at least an upper and lower bound, right now you could set arbitrarily small or large resolutions (this might be a good way to crash gazebo and invalidate the run? ;) ).
